alert.note: Alert for Potter (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 09 at 9:41AM CDT until June 10 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Texas... Canadian River at Amarillo 19N affecting Potter County. For the Canadian River...including Amarillo 19N...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Canadian River at Amarillo 19N. * WHEN...From this morning to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Dirt road that runs east alongside the river channel becomes flooded. This road leads to Rosita Creek Flats Recreation Area, where primitive camping occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 4.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 4.0 feet this afternoon. It will then rise to a crest of 6.0 feet this evening. It will fall to around 4.7 feet Saturday morning, and then remain below action stage through Sunday. - Action stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 945 PM CDT.
